result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric K Post was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr:
Fine - $246.55
DNA surchg - $200.00
Dom Ab surchg - $100.00

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release. To be used by probation agent if necessary.

Must follow through with all recommendations of Probation. If Probation deems necessary an AODA assessment must comply. Probation may petition court for early release from probation. Must report to Probation no later than Monday 9/26/2016 by 4:30pm.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. If not paid by end of probation may be reduced to a civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to Probation while on Probation. If not paid by end of probation may be reduced to a civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
Must pay a Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100.00 while on Probation to Probation. If not paid by the end of Probation may be reduced to a civil judgment.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
No abusive contact with Shilo Gall. Absolute sobriety.
